page.title: 13TRANSPORT:RURAL AREAS
page.content: The favourite way of travelling is by car.Most families have a car.Others travel by bus.Three private coach firms are in the area.Marchants use the A435 to{Bishop's Cleeve.}Pulham coaches go to{Brockhampton}, Swanbrookes to{Elmstone Hardwicke}and provide a school bus to{Swindon {Village}.Cheltenham District Bus Company run a daily service to{Swindon {Village}and{Bishop's Cleeve.}Some people use trains. There is a railway line in the area.We watched the trains at the unmanned level crossing.It is on the {Bristol to Birmingham}main line,with connections to{London}and{ {Wales}.The line branches,further N, to {Worchester}.To catch a train you have to bus, get a taxi or drive by car,5 Km to the station in {Cheltenham.} Inter City 125,rail cars,freighters and coal trains use the line.
